summary: This bill, the New York-New Jersey Watershed Protection Act, establishes a program to coordinate restoration and protection activities in the New York-New Jersey Watershed. It directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish a non-regulatory program and a voluntary grant program to support habitat restoration, water quality improvement, and community engagement, particularly focusing on communities experiencing environmental injustice. It mandates a Watershed-wide strategy and requires annual reports to Congress. The bill authorizes appropriations for these activities and sets a sunset date.
